meanings.definition: Happening or existing outside of the legal system
meanings.sent1: The extrajudicial punishment was given without involving the court system.
meanings.sent2: The activist group condemned the extrajudicial killings in the region.
meanings.sent3: The extrajudicial picnic in the park was a fun but illegal event.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to take extrajudicial action against the bully was like a lightning strike.
meanings.sent5: The extrajudicial graffiti on the wall stood out like a sore thumb.

meanings.definition: Carried out without legal authority or due process
meanings.sent1: The extrajudicial eviction of the tenants shocked the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The rebel group was accused of extrajudicial executions of captured soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The extrajudicial bake sale at school was a delicious but unlawful affair.
meanings.sent4: Her extrajudicial decision to skip the line caused a stir in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The extrajudicial decision to cut the red wire was a risky move.

meanings.sent1: The extrajudicial search of the premises violated privacy rights.
meanings.sent2: The company faced criticism for their extrajudicial business practices.
meanings.sent3: The extrajudicial dance party in the office was a lively but illegal event.
meanings.sent4: His extrajudicial attempt to access the restricted area was like hitting a brick wall.
meanings.sent5: The extrajudicial decision to ignore the warning signs led to trouble.
